description.narrative: - The development impact of the proposed project will be assessed using the AIMM framework. Project-level impacts are expected through employment creation both during the construction and operation phases as well as through economic activities along the value chain, especially at the downstream end with Nabati's extensive sales force and distributors. - The Project will also increase tax revenues in Majalengka, a frontier region in Indonesia where the minimum salary is US$150 per month vs. US$ 200 in the closest largest city (Bandung) or US$ 250 in Jakarta. The Project will also improve incomes of the SMEs which supply materials to Nabati. - The Project is also expected to contribute to food security for bottom of the pyramid consumers. The new facilities to be funded by IFC will produce low market pricing products which are fortified with vitamins A, B1, B2, B6 and B12 (currently ~80% of Nabati's products are fortified).

In 1985, Mr Krisdianto Lesmana and his wife, Mrs Ida Surjati Djaja Mukti established a traditional snack company serving the local market in Indonesia. In 2003, this home industry business was transformed to PT Kaldu Sari Nabati Indonesia (Nabati or the Company), a producer of wafers, biscuits, snacks and confectioneries under two principle brands: Richeese and Richoco. The Company owns three plants in Indonesia in the cities of Cicalengka, Rancaekek and Majalengka, all located in West Java. The proposed investment is an up to US$100 million loan package comprising up to US$ 40 million A loan, up to US$ 30 million B Loan and up to US$ 30 million MCPP Loan to Nabati to support the expansion of its wafers, biscuits and snacks factory in Majalengka (the Project). The Project is expected to cost US$133 million of which US$33 million is from internally generated cash.

name.narrative: The Project will be located in Majalengka, West Java, Indonesia.
